common_issues.title: Invalid Discord Invite Links Across Pieces Platforms
common_issues.description: Multiple reports indicate broken Discord invite links on the Pieces website, documentation, and Pieces OS.  The links provided are either expired or incorrect. A permanent, non-expiring link should be created and updated across all platforms to resolve this.

related_issues.title: Discord link provided is invalid on the website
related_issues.text:
Discord link provided is invalid on the website
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Marketing Site (pieces.app)

### Operating System / Platform

Web

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The main Pieces website [page](<https://pieces.app>) offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.gg/getpieces>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/106f7b8e-0f74-4efa-a6ec-9cfe48133198)

The support [page](<https://docs.pieces.app/products/support>) of Pieces documentation website offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.com/invite/getpieces>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87064aff-9a18-420f-bb9f-a86e358e3dea)

Both of the above Discord invite links are invalid. You should create one without an expiration date and replace all those.

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
related_issues.text:
Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.0

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. Start Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers and use them as normal.
2. Open a tab with a large amount of content. In my case, it was a GitLab CI job with a 6k line job log. I also experienced crashes with ArgoCD when having 100+ apps on a page.
3. Both Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers crash. There are no corresponding log records in the Support directory, only logs about application startup.

Sometimes it freezes Chrome completely.

I have 16GB RAM, 12 vCPU, and have never experienced such behavior without Pieces.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Freezes and High Resource Usage
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop freezing after inactivity, especially after using chat functionality.  High CPU and GPU usage are also observed, particularly on older hardware. Issues occur across Windows and macOS, potentially related to Long Term Memory and large content in browser tabs.  Restarting Pieces Desktop is a temporary workaround. Further investigation into resource management and memory leaks is needed.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS - 11.4.1
Pieces Desktop - 4.1.3

Pieces desktop randomly freezes after a period of inactivity. I would interact with it in a chat, go back to working in another app and after a while go back to Desktop to find it had frozen. Restart of Pieces Desktop is needed. Note that this problem is very frequent since latest update on May 22nd, but not systematic. I had also noticed this kind of behavior before the updated but put it on the count of my Hardware, Intel i5, 16Gbram Asus Vivobook, but I think I can dismiss this theory.

Where it gets tricky is that this behavior seems to only happen if I had, prior to returning to Pieces Desktop, interacted with a chat. In cases where I simply had started Desktop, worked on something else and gone back to Desktop, it would keep working properly.

Noteworthy: LTM is enabled by default for all chats. Default LLM: Claude 3.7 Sonnet.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset.
related_issues.text: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset. ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.3.6 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. When i run pieces desktop app and pieces os. My macbook pro fan starts at the top speed which results to slows down my pc. I will add some details related to my macbook and pieces version with some screen shots. **Mac details -** Processor - 2.2 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7 Graphics - Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB Memory - 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 MacOS - 15.5 (24F74) Pieces Desktop version - 4.1.2 Pieces OS - 11.3.6 **Images for CPU and GPU Usage** Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Performance Issues on macOS and Windows
common_issues.description: Users report performance issues with the Pieces Desktop app on macOS and Windows. On macOS, the app periodically jumps to the main monitor and grabs focus, along with high CPU/GPU usage and system slowdown. On Windows, the app freezes after a period of inactivity, especially after interacting with a chat. Reinstalling the app and checking for extra processes may resolve focus issues.  Further investigation is needed for freezing and performance issues, potentially related to LTM and specific hardware configurations.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop and VS Code extension freezing/loading issues
common_issues.description: Users report freezing or infinite loading in Pieces Desktop and VS Code extension.  Desktop freezes after inactivity, especially after chat interaction. VS Code extension's copy button also exhibits infinite loading. Issues occur across different Pieces OS versions (11.3.6, 11.4.1, 11.42) and Windows OS.  Suggested solutions include restarting Pieces Desktop, checking LTM settings, and ensuring stable internet connection.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and VS Code Integration Issues on Windows
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting Pieces OS with VS Code on Windows, especially within WSL.  Problems include empty settings windows in VS Code, inability to install Pieces extensions,  indefinite loading of the copy button, and invalid Discord invite links.  Suggested solutions include verifying network connectivity between WSL and Pieces OS, checking Pieces OS logs for errors, and ensuring the Pieces VS Code extension is properly installed and configured.

related_issues.title: WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
related_issues.text:
WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to use Pieces extensions in VS Code for WSL:Ubuntu. Piesces Setting window is empty, but earlier it showed two buttons Launch and Install and when you click on Install, for example, VS Code shows notification that it can't connect to Pieces OS. I tried multiple fixes I found. One is to set Custom URL for Remote environment and I tried with <Windows IP>:1000 and with NGrok forwarding of same url, both without success and I could reach both with curl. There are some errors in VS Code Developer tools related to Pieces OS extension:

Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: version is longer than 256 characters
at new it (settingsView.js:1:5120)
at UH (settingsView.js:1:9927)
at Object.tU (settingsView.js:1:10530)
at vN (settingsView.js:19:354749)

at
https://vscode-remote+wsl-002bubuntu.vscode-resource.vscode-cdn.net/home/vladan/.vscode-server/extensions/meshintelligenttechnologiesinc.pieces-vscode-2.0.6/dist/settingsView.js

and Pieces OS log shows error:

GET     [404] /assets/stream/identifiers: port:Instance of 'Future<int>': (2nd server)


Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Discord link provided is invalid in Pieces OS
related_issues.text:
Discord link provided is invalid in Pieces OS
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS app offers the following Discord invite link: <https://discord.gg/ubn8JFAXQ7>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/894385e1-db70-49fc-8f48-f5abafadeac0)

The above Discord invite link is invalid. You should create one without an expiration date and replace it.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Discord invite link issue across all platforms (website, documentation, Pieces OS).  This is a recurring problem affecting multiple users.

Investigate and address the performance issues (freezing, high resource usage) reported for Pieces Desktop on both Windows and macOS. Focus on resource management and potential memory leaks, especially after chat usage and with LTM enabled.
Improve VS Code extension stability and resolve the infinite loading issue with the copy button.  Also, investigate WSL connectivity problems on Windows.
Address the reported Pieces Desktop crashes when Chrome tabs contain large amounts of content. This may indicate memory or resource management issues within the Pieces Desktop application itself.

Review and update the support documentation with troubleshooting steps for common issues like WSL connectivity, VS Code integration, and performance problems.  This will empower users to self-resolve and reduce support ticket volume.
Consider adding more robust error logging and reporting within Pieces Desktop and its integrations to facilitate faster debugging and resolution of issues.
Monitor user feedback closely for emerging trends and prioritize addressing the most frequent and impactful issues to improve overall user experience and satisfaction.
Proactively communicate known issues and planned fixes to the user community through a dedicated channel (e.g., status page, forum) to manage expectations and reduce support inquiries.
Analyze the relationship between Pieces OS versions and reported issues to identify potential regressions and prioritize fixes for affected versions.
Implement automated testing to catch common issues like broken links and basic functionality before they reach users, reducing the need for reactive support interventions.
